keyword: calories in a cup of rice uncooked
title: Calories in a Cup of Uncooked Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in a cup of rice uncooked, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tweaks and FAQs.
h1: Calories in a Cup of Uncooked Rice
assumptions: Long-grain white rice, uncooked; 1 cup â‰ˆ 185 g dry weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type (e.g., white, brown), brand, grain length, and exact measurement; cooked values differ due to water absorption. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A cup of uncooked white rice has about 675 kcal, primarily from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp vegetable oil per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of rice uncooked?
faqs.a: About 675 kcal for 1 cup (185 g) of long-grain white rice uncooked.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in a cup of uncooked rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 148 g of carbohydrates, with 2.4 g fiber and 0.4 g sugars.

faqs.q: Does rice type affect calories in a cup uncooked?
faqs.a: Yes; brown rice adds ~9 kcal, while basmati reduces by ~14 kcal per cup.

faqs.q: How does uncooked rice compare to cooked calories?
faqs.a: Uncooked is denser; 1 cup uncooked yields ~3 cups cooked with ~200-250 kcal per cooked cup due to water.

faqs.q: Is protein high in a cup of uncooked rice?
faqs.a: Moderate at 13 g per cup; rice is mainly a carb source, not protein.
